name: Clacks Overhead WG
body:
> 'We keep that name moving in the Overhead,' he said, and it seemed to Princess
> that the wind in the shutter arrays above her blew more forlornly, and the
> everlasting clicking of the shutters grew more urgent. 'He'd never have wanted to
> go home. He was a *real* linesman. His name is in the code, in the wind, in the rigging,
> and the shutters. Haven't you ever heard the saying "Man's not dead while his name is still spoken"?'

It started [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/discworld/comments/2ysv26/sir_terry_has_gone_for_the_long_walk_across_the/cpcmru1).

The tribute spread to the rest of the World Wide Web in the form of the HTTP header `X-Clacks-Overhead: GNU Terry Pratchett`. The Clacks Overhead Working Group was formed to make the Clacks header an Internet standard.

Read and contribute to the [draft RFC](https://github.com/clacks-overhead/clacks-protocol)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
